beak.methods.som.nextsomcore.lrnfile module

The module contains functions to read lrn-files

@author: Janne Kallunki

beak.methods.som.nextsomcore.lrnfile.load_lrn_file(input_file)[source]

Load files of lrn file format

Parameters:

input_file (str) – input file path

Returns:

dictionary holding the data as a ndarray and meta data such as numer of rows and column, column (data) names, file type

Return type:

dict

beak.methods.som.nextsomcore.lrnfile.read_lrn_header(input_file)[source]

read metadata from files of lrn file format

Parameters:

input_file (str) – input file path

Raises:

  • Exception – Failed to obtain valid row count from lrn-file.

  • Exception – Failed to obtain valid column count from lrn-file.

  • Exception – Failed to convert column type values

  • Exception – Column names don’t match with the column types.

Returns:

dictionary holding meta data from input file, such as numer of rows and column, column (data) names, file type

Return type:

dict

beak.methods.som.nextsomcore.lrnfile.read_lrn_coordinate_columns(lrn_header)[source]

Read coordinate columns from dictionary

Parameters:

lrn_header (dict) – dictionary holding the data as a ndarray and meta data, such as numer of rows and column, column (data) names, file type

Returns:

dictionary holding coordinates as a ndarray, column names and format

Return type:

dict

beak.methods.som.nextsomcore.lrnfile.read_lrn_data_columns(lrn_header)[source]

Read data columns from dictionary

Parameters:

lrn_header (dict) – dictionary holding the data including coordinates as a ndarray and meta data, such as numer of rows and column, column (data) names, file type

Returns:

dictionary holding data columns as a ndarray, column names and format

Return type:

dict

beak.methods.som.nextsomcore.lrnfile._read_columns(lrn_header, columns, fmt='')[source]

read columns from dictionary

Parameters:

  • lrn_header (dict) – dictionary holding the data as a ndarray and meta data

  • columns (list[int]) – list of columns to return

  • fmt (str, optional) – format. Defaults to ‘’.

Raises:

TypeError – Invalid type: columns must be a list or tuple

Returns:

dictionary holding selected data columns as a ndarray, column names and format

Return type:

dict
